intro: Gamochaeta hiemalis, commonly known as the winter muiraçama, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, pinkish to white flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Gamochaeta hiemalis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
